intro: Psychotria leleana, commonly known as the "Lelean's Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
